data.title: Address, Directions, & Travel Tips
data.meta_description: Visiting The Metropolitan Museum of Art? Here's a detailed guide on how to get to The Met NYC, including its address, location, & the best routes to take!
data.text:
By Bus

From the East Side of Manhattan: Take the M1, M2, M3, or M4 bus along Fifth Avenue (from uptown locations) to 82nd Street or along Madison Avenue (from downtown locations) to 83rd Street.

From the West Side of Manhattan: Catch the C train to 81st Street, then the M79 bus across Central Park to Fifth Avenue.

From Penn Station: Hop on the M4 bus to 83rd Street and Madison Avenue.

From The Met Cloisters: Directly take the M4 bus to 82nd Street and Fifth Avenue.

By Subway

From the East Side of Manhattan: Hop on the 4, 5, or 6 train to 86th Street, and walk three blocks west to Fifth Avenue. This walk is about a half mile and takes approximately 10 minutes.

From the West Side of Manhattan: Take the 1 train to 86th Street, then the M86 crosstown bus across Central Park to Fifth Avenue.

From Penn Station: Ride the C local train to 81st Street and transfer to the M79 crosstown bus across Central Park to Fifth Avenue.

From The Met Cloisters: Take the A train to 125th Street, transfer to the B or C local train, exit at 81st Street, and transfer to the M79 crosstown bus across Central Park to Fifth Avenue.

Driving Route

Travel Time: 15 to 20 minutes from anywhere in Manhattan

From The Met Cloisters, Bronx, Northern New Jersey, and New England: Take southbound Henry Hudson Parkway to 96th Street exit; cross Central Park and turn right on Fifth Avenue.

From JFK International Airport: Get on I-678 N from 130th Pl and continue on I-678 N. Take Grand Central Pkwy and I-278 E to FDR Dr in Manhattan. Take exit 14 from FDR Dr. Follow E 96th St to 5th Ave/Museum Mile.

From Times Square: Head southeast on W 46th St toward Broadway and turn left onto Madison Avenue. Turn left onto E 83rd St, then turn left onto 5th Ave/Museum Mile.
